greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the divisors of 24*n - 1.
comment: All terms are multiples of 24 [Gupta, Sierpinski].  - Vincenzo Librandi, Apr 07 2011
Note that 24n - 1 is also the denominator of the Bruinier-Ono finite algebraic formula for the number of partitions of n (Cf. A183010).
link: H. Gupta, Congruent properties of sigma(n), Math. Student 13 (1945) 25-29
W. Sierpinski, Elementary Theory of numbers, Monografie Mathematyczne, vol 42 (1964) chapt 4, p. 168
example: For n = 5 we have that 24*5 - 1 = 119, and the sum of the divisors of 119 is 1 + 7 + 17 + 119 = 144, so a(5) = 144.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Dec 25 2016
